findings.title: ELFM - Exceeds Fees Limit
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to increase over the allowed limit of 25%. The owner may take advantage of it by calling the `setTaxFeePercent` function with a high percentage value.

findings.title: FRV - Fee Restoration Vulnerability
findings.description: The contract demonstrates a potential vulnerability upon removing and restoring the fees when the fees have been set to zero.

findings.title: IFM - Inconsistent Fee Mechanism
findings.description: The contract calculates a `stakingAmt` variable, which represents a percentage of the transferred amount. This percentage is deducted from the original amount, and the tax is then applied to the remaining amount. As a result, the fees are not calculated proportionally.

findings.title: MEM - Misleading Error Messages
findings.description: The contract uses misleading error messages that do not accurately reflect the problem, making it difficult to identify and fix the issue.

findings.title: AOI - Arithmetic Operations Inconsistency
findings.description: The contract uses both SafeMath library and native arithmetic operations, which can introduce inconsistencies and undermine safety measures.

findings.title: RRS - Redundant Require Statement
findings.description: The contract utilizes a `require` statement within the `add` function aiming to prevent overflow errors, which is redundant due to Solidity version 0.8.0 and later reverting on overflow and underflow.

findings.title: EPC - Existing Pair Creation
findings.description: The contract contains the `setRouterAddress` function that does not handle the scenario where a pair already exists prior to its execution.

findings.title: RSW - Redundant Storage Writes
findings.description: The contract performs redundant storage writes when the provided parameter matches the current state of the variables, leading to unnecessary gas consumption and inefficiencies in contract execution.

findings.title: RES - Redundant Event Statement
findings.description: The `MinTokensBeforeSwapUpdated` event statement is not used in the contract's implementation.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions 0.8.0 and above have native functionality that replaces it.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that their value is initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure their values cannot be changed after being set, which also decreases gas consumption.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity style guide, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract. They are often used to notify external parties or clients about events that have occurred within the contract, such as the transfer of tokens or the completion of a task.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L17 - Usage of Solidity Assembly
findings.description: Using assembly can be error-prone and requires careful testing and debugging to ensure correctness.
